trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of patient decision aid for Localized Prostate cancer patients in Referral hospitals in peninsular Malaysia.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of a patient decision aid booklet on knowledge, decisional conflict, and satisfaction with preparation for decision making ,with localised prostate cancer patients in referral hospitals in Peninsular Malaysia

interventions.interventions: Patient Decision Aid Booklet provide guide for treatment option for localized prostate cancer patient,the treatment option stated in the booklet are watchful waiting,active surveillance,radiotherapy and surgery, radiation therapy and surgery option that available in Malaysia. Each of treatment option,describe on the procedures will be implement by doctor,the advantages and disadvantages and other issues that should patient concern about. Patient will be given the booklet after consultation with the doctor who will discuss about the treatment options, after the patient consultation with doctor, researcher will briefly explain to the patient about the booklet after the consultation session. Then patient will bring the booklet home for further reading and discuss with their family.
interventions.comparator: Following standard usual care means that the patient will only received consultation with the doctor who will discuss about the treatment options verbally. Patient will not be given the decision aid booklet after consultation.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Knowledge assessed by validated Prostate cancer Knowledge questionnaire
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Randomization is done by random block by week. Patients will be randomized to either intervention or control according to the weeks they come for follow up. For each control and intervention group,assessment of knowledge and decisional conflict will be done at 4 points after randomization. 1) Before consultation for second follow up with the doctor 2) After consultation during second follow up with the doctor 3) Before consultation for third follow up with the doctor 4) After consultation for third follow up with the doctor

primaryOutcome.outcome: Decisional conflict assessed by validated Decisional conflict scale (DCS) questionnaire
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Randomization is done by random block by week. Patients will be randomized to either intervention or control according to the weeks they come for follow up. For each control and intervention group,assessment of knowledge and decisional conflict will be done at 4 points after randomization. 1) Before consultation for second follow up with the doctor 2) After consultation during second follow up with the doctor 3) Before consultation for third follow up with the doctor 4) After consultation for third follow up with the doctor

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Assessment of preparation for decision making is done by using 10 items with likert scale questionnaire.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint:
Randomization is done by random block by week. Patients will be randomized to either intervention or control according to the weeks they come for follow up. For each control and intervention group, assessment of satisfaction with preparation for decision making will be done at 3 points after randomization.
1) After consultation during second follow up with the doctor 2) Before consultation for third follow up with the doctor 3) After consultation for third follow up with the doctor

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
1) Patient who are diagnosed with localized prostate cancer (stage 1 and stage 2) in (0-16 weeks of diagnosing) who has not make any decision about treatment option.
2) Being candidates with at least two treatment option.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
1) Patients who are ill (patient who might have a symptoms of e.g urinary retention and not feeling comfortable during the assessment session)
2) Patients refuse to involve in the research project. 3) Patient with cognitive impairment.

trial_design.concealment: Randomization were done by permuted block by week. Allocation of control or intervention group by week involved contacting the holder of the allocation schedule who is “off-site” or at central administration site.
trial_design.sequence: Statistical Package For Social Science Programmed(SPSS)
